The issue description is:

```text
Httpie fails on too long filenames (but works fine with -o filename), wget shortens them automatically.

Thanks for your work, httpie is great!

http --version
0.9.3

$ http -d https://camo.githubusercontent.

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/bin/http", line 9, in <module>
    load_entry_point('httpie==0.9.3', 'console_scripts', 'http')()
  File "/usr/lib/python3.5/site-packages/httpie/core.py", line 149, in main
    download_stream, download_to = download.start(response)
  File "/usr/lib/python3.5/site-packages/httpie/downloads.py", line 235, in start
    self._output_file = open(get_unique_filename(filename), mode='a+b')
http: error: OSError: [Errno 36] File name too long: '.jpe'
wget https://camo.githubusercontent.
The name is too long, 358 chars total.
Trying to shorten...

New name is 68747470733a2f2f75706c6f61642e77696b696d656469612e6f72672f77696b6970656469612f636f6d6d6f6e732f7468756d622f652f65632f4d6f6e615f4c6973612c5f62795f4c656f6e6172646f5f64615f56696e63692c5f66726f6d5f4332524d465f7265746f75636865642e6a70672f3638.
```
